Key Match Events: Memphis Grizzlies won 134-89 against Portland Trail Blazers.
Zach Edey finished with 12 points, six rebounds, two assists, three steals, and a block.
Jaren Jackson Jr. led the Grizzlies with 20 points, seven rebounds, and three steals.
Jake LaRavia scored 18 points off the bench.
Scotty Pippen Jr. filled in for Ja Morant and finished with 17 points, four rebounds, and three assists.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Taylor Jenkins opted for a smaller lineup due to injuries, starting Scotty Pippen Jr., Jaylen Wells, Santi Aldama, Jaren Jackson Jr., and Brandon Clarke.
Post-Match Reflections: The Grizzlies improved to 7-4 for the season despite early injury woes.
Zach Edey was not a big factor in the game but will learn from his turnovers.
Edey looked more comfortable playing with the bench players.
